ForearmsDBRadialFlexion.name: Dumbbell Radial Deviation
ForearmsDBRadialFlexion.preparation: Grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on thumb side. Position arm down to side.
ForearmsDBRadialFlexion.execution: Bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. Lower until weighted side is pointing downward. Repeat.
ForearmsDBRadialFlexion.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used. Empty metal bar to increase resistance grasp further away from center with longer end on thumb side.Standard dumbbell grasp so pinkie side is against inside of weight plate.

ForearmsDBReverseWristCurl.name: Dumbbell Reverse Wrist Curl
ForearmsDBReverseWristCurl.preparation: Sit and grip dumbbell with overhand grip. Rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
ForearmsDBReverseWristCurl.execution: Raise dummbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. Return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. Repeat.
ForearmsDBReverseWristCurl.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.
